comment.author: 31846825@N04
comment._content: Accompanying note: "The tobacco crop is never in the sun. Cheesecloth shields the growing plant from the direct rays of the sun. The crop is harvested in the shade and carried to the drying barns in covered wagons."
comment.authorname: State Library and Archives of Florida

comment.author: 60537062@N06
comment._content: This little boy will go home hot, tired and covered in tobacco sap. This is hard child labor and not long ago.
